onyomiExamples.meaning: violation, offense, offence, breach, transgression, infringement, contravention
illegality, police and judicial chief (Heian and Kamakura periods)

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to differ (from), to vary, to not be in the usual condition, to not match the correct (answer, etc.), to be different from promised, isn't it?, wasn't it?
sure, no mistaking it, for certain, without doubt
to change, to alter, to mistake, to make a mistake, to fail to keep (e.g. one's promise), to sprain (a muscle), to dislocate (e.g. one's neck)
to differ, to be different, to run counter to, to change (into something out of the ordinary)
to change, to alter, to run counter to, to go against, to break (one's word), to make a mistake (in), to err
